comments:
The Error i get: IWAB0014E Unexpected exception occured. (Details: see below)

Situation: A dynamic web project is referenced by another project (a Java project). When i try to create a web service from a class which is inside the dynamic web project an error occurs. To be exact: I right-click the class and select "Web Services"->"Create web service". After clicking "Next >" or "Finished" on the "Service Deployment Configuration" screen the error message pops up.

After deleting the reference everything works fine.
This bug is reproducable on my system.

uname -a:

Lennart,
this is an interesting twist which we haven't seen before. We've had trouble between Web projects and Java projects before, only where the Web project depends on the Java project, and the Java project contains the Java class from which we're trying to create the Web service. Just to confirm, in your scenario you are trying to create a Web service from a Java class in a Web project (the golden path), but for some reason, declaring a dependency from your Java project TO your Web project causes the scenario to fail. That is, your Java class in the Web project depends on nothing from the Java project, true?

Kathy,
would you try reproducing this please?

This is a dup of bug 121186 which had been dropped to the 101 M build.  I tried your scenario (creating Web service from a Web project depended on by a Java project) with the WTP 1.0 driver and the M200601170000 driver from:

http://download.eclipse.org/webtools/downloads/drops/M-M200601170000-200601170000/

I confirmed that the problem is in WTP 1.0 and is fixed in M200601170000 driver.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 121186 ***

As we are trying to close down WTP 1.5, please get the latest WTP 1.5 driver to verify the bug and reopen if the problem had not been fixed.  If this defect is not verified/reopened by end of day 06/16, I'll attempt to verify the defect by reproducing the problem as described in the defect.  However, since you know your scenario best, it would be more appropriate if you verify the fix.

Kathy,

unfortunately I am no longer in posession of the project that produced the error (it was produced during an internship at the University of Koblenz-Landau, Germany - since the internship has ended, i don't have access anymore) and the OS & IDE i was running were  erased during the recovery from a hd-crash.

I can try to reproduce the bug using a simple project if this can help.

...?
This is part of a mass update to close out all stale WTP bugs which are in the resolved state without an appropriate targeted version.  If you feel this bug was closed inappropriately, please reopen.
